Police have no suspects yet and have asked all Black Vomit fans not to show up at the funeral which, by the way, will be held at the Hollywood Cemetery at midnight.  In homage, here's the last video of Bobby Vomit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford mouths "wow" to himself as the rock video begins.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO
dialogues.text: A lacerating TUNE BLASTS forth with Bobby Vomit writhing around a cage.  Inside the cafe is a beautifully modulate babe with monster makeup all over her face.  The rest of Black Vomit dutifully play their instruments at the back of the set, all wearing doctor uniforms. Vomit pulls the babe's monster-faced head out from betwee the bars of the cage.  He savagely kisses her and then runs to the door of the cage.  He flings it open.  The babe no longer has the face of a monster.  She has the face of Zuzu Petals for that is who the babe is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford does a vodka milkshake spit-take.

dialogues.speaker: VIDEO
dialogues.text: In closeup, Zuzu blows the VIEWER a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WITH Spotlights, with T-shirt hawkers and with a couple hundred mournful rock and roll fans pushing and shoving at the gate, the viewer believes they are at a concert not a funeral. A hurriedly dressed Ford, tucking his shirt in, approache the gate.  He focuses upon a SLEAZY GUY doing something with two girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one hundred.  Each.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two girls nod -- Sleazy Guy hands them something -- the girls leave. Ford approaches as the Sleazy Guy carefully calls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got those Vomit invites here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scalping to a funeral, you're a pretty sleazy guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  You interested.  It's festival seating, so...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave it to the girls for one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, they blew me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.  Three hundred coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford very quickly hands over three hundred dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford mounts a small hill to blend into the already-in- progress funeral.  Many people stand in various not necessarily tasteful black clothes.  A row of nubile mournettes kneel praying, the lipstick on their face is noticeably and obscenely askew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, am I the only one who paid full price here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A priest stands next to a big empty hole.  The band members of Black Vomit are situated behind it, with their instruments.  They begin a mournful metal jam. The sound of a HELICOPTER is heard.  Everyone seems to be ignoring this fact but Ford.  A chopper is cruising toward the funeral. The CHOPPER sounds get LOUDER as the helicopter positions itself over the open grave.  The band increases its intensify as the crowd chants "Vomit!  Vomit!  Vomit!"  A large transparent tube is pushed out of the helicopter with an attached black parachute.  The tube is lit up by round dressing room-style bulbs. The tube floats down toward the grave.  Ford and the VIEWER get to see that in the lit tube is Bobby Vomit. It swooshes perfectly into the grave. Ford shakes his head in amazement.  Getting serious, he pulls the picture of Zuzu Petals from his pocket and scans the crowd.  More young, pretty girls in sexy black pass before the grave, but no Zuzu. A GIRL IN A BLACK VEIL (three guesses who) quietly sobs beside Ford, holding the black purse from the opening scene (okay, one guess who).  With a whimper, she puts her head against Ford's stomach.  By reflex, Ford puts his arm around to comfort, but his eyes never leave the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so good...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he was one of the greats. (holding out the photo) Hey, you haven't seen this girl, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this a trick question?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl In her Veil lifts her veil.  It is Zuzu Petals. Ford goes insane with victory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu Petals!  Zuzu Petals!  Yes! Who killed Bobby Vomit?  Who killed Johnny Crunch?  Why do people want you so goddamn bad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  I'm so scared. Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu drops to her knees before Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A simple 'please' would suffice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluck you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu fiercely balls her fist and punches Ford in the groin.  She then bolts up and starts sprinting away. Ford gasps after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluck me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu keeps running.  She gives a glance back toward Ford as a black gloved hand thrusts out and grabs her by the neck.  The arm leads to the maliciously chipper face of Smiley. Smiley lifts Zuzu up and heaves her into a sidecar connected to a state of the art motorcycle.  With a painful crash, Zuzu lands upside-down in the sidecar. Smiley straddles the BIKE and ROCKETS off, recklessly weaving through tombstones. Panting, Ford stops running toward the motorcycle.  He changes direction and begins running... until he reaches his Fairlane.  Ford wails in anger for his tires have been punctured.  The PHONE in his car suddenly RINGS.  Ford reaches in and pulls out the portable phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-O-D-S is going to make me rich!

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: Smiley is revealed to be barking on a cellular phone, attached to his motorcycle while burrowing through the tombstones.  Zuzu's legs flail from out of the sidecar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?  Radio station contest.  Ford, I mean really...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The super-bike sends frightened mourners into empty buria holes.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER PART OF CEMETERY GROUNDS
dialogues.text: Portable phone pushed up under his armpit, receiver be- tween his head and his shoulder, Ford barrels up a hill..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you hurt her, I'll kill you! Maybe not personally, but I'll think of something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the hill is a parked hearse.

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: Two slimy MORTICIANS come out from the back of the hearse.  They are each smoking a cigarette and zipping up their pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some days it's great to be alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford charges into the front seat of the hearse.  He turns the ignition key and tears off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, he took Lydia!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving his zipper a final yank) So what, we've had our fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The body of a VOLUPTUOUS WOMAN rests naked on a gurney in the back of the hearse.  The gurney wobbles back and forth toward Ford in the driver's seat.  A tag on her hand reads LYDIA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now it's getting interesting, Smileyhead.

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE
dialogues.text: Smiley blazes across the gravesite green towards the entrance.  A discombobulated Zuzu twists into a sitting position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, I'd be up for a bullshit car chase, but I got to get up early tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley looks down to his phone with a quizzical ex- pression.  In the b.g. the hearse can be seen barrelling over a hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford, where did you go?  Don't be such a baby...

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: Ford intensely weaves through burial paths.  His point of view has the motorcycle getting closer.

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE AT CEMETERY ENTRANCE
dialogues.text: Smiley hangs up the phone, and ROARS into the street out- side the cemetery.  Zuzu scowls, until Ford pulls up beside them, shouting out his window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were saying, snapperhead?  I'll bet you're not smiling now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, but I am.  Dianetics, Ford.  You should try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say cheese...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford super-swiftly raises his arm activating the sliding gun apparatus.  The gun sails out of his sleeve, past his hand, out of his car, and over Smiley who rightfully laug

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, but I have my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley pulls a serious GUN from his coat and BLASTS away. Ford steers off as the BULLETS shower into his hood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (regarding Ford, amused) My hero...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HEARSE convulses in a mind-roasting SKID causing the other poor cars in the vicinity to insanely slam into lampposts, mini-malls, and themselves.

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: All this motion commotion causes the body of the Vol- uptuous Woman to burst out from the back and to crash into the front seat.  Ford shrieks at the inert, well- endowed flesh.  Suddenly, the PHONE RINGS.  Ford fren- etically picks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, man!  I can't talk... Mom!  What are you calling for? No, no, I don't always answer the phone like that.  It's business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The naked body bounces and bashes against Ford as he speaks.  The voluptuous head slams down onto Ford's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have I met any nice girls?  Ma, Ma, get some sleep.  I gotta another call... (pressing call waiting) Sorry, it was my mom...

dialogues.speaker: MOTORCYCLE GOING UP INCREDIBLY INCLINED STREET
dialogues.text: Riding up a steep hill, Smiley deliriously chats...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your mom is special.  I look forward to raping her at your funeral.

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: Ford is comically maneuvering the body into a sitting position and pulling over a seat belt... He shouts in the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are one sick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford hangs up, letting go of the seat belt.  Ford watches the body's ludicrously bouncing breasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn baby, I hope you filled out some organ donor cards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford looks out the windshield and howls.

dialogues.speaker: INCREDIBLY INCLINED STREET
dialogues.text: The hearse slams into the base of the very steep hill, it rockets upward. The dead body flips and flops over into the back seat. The hearse flies over the hill and whizzes forward, approaching Smiley's motorcycle.  Ford pulls up beside Zuzu in the sidecar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu Petals, I'm Ford Fairlane! I'm the good guy, he's the bad guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entertained, Smiley FIRES his GUN at the hearse.  Ford swerves around behind the motorcycle to Smiley's side. Zuzu loops her purse around her neck and then, with a devilish grin, she stands up in the sidecar.  Smiley watches incredulously as Zuzu jumps from the sidecar onto the motorcycle between his legs and then, after blowing a kiss, into the open passenger window of the hearse. A disoriented Smiley swerves off onto a sidewalk, zipping past freaked out pedestrians.

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: Zuzu lands onto the passenger seat with a giggle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is so amazing!  A car chase! Let's get on some car chase music! Ra-a-w-wk!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu turns ON the RADIO and turns it UP LOUD.  Ford can only stare at this perverse girl in amazement.  Zuzu looks over to him, popping a bubblegum bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's red, Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The hearse charges through a red light causing another collision.

dialogues.speaker: HEARSE
dialogues.text: Ford looks into the rearview mirror.  Smiley is back on the street and gaining... Ford reaches into a confused Zuzu's mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give me your gum and grab the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: The MOTORCYCLE WAILS up the back of the hearse.  Smiley reaches out to the door and flings it open.  He leaps...

dialogues.speaker: INTO HEARSE
dialogues.text: A BATTERED but still giddy Smiley crawls and crashes into the front seat, pulling a gun on the driver:  The voluptu ous body! Smiley looks to the floor pedal.  Pink gum holds it to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: STREET BEHIND HEARSE
dialogues.text: Crunched in a heap on the street, Ford and Zuzu move into painful standing positions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (are you kidding?) Peachy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weirded-out Smiley turns from his bizarre driver to look before him.  His smile turns into a grimace.

dialogues.speaker: STREET
dialogues.text: A multi-transport truck is parked at the curb and its ramp is down.  The hearse hits the ramp -- flies in the air towards --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With its famous Cadillac embedded halfway into the roof. CRASH! -- it now has two cars embedded halfway into the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bodies of Smiley and the Voluptuous Woman fly through the WINDSHIELD and sail into the GLASS roof of the Cafe. Smiley smashes into the floor while the voluptuous woman crashes down onto a birthday cake atop a table surrounded by aghast yuppies. The Voluptuous Woman awakens with a purr...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boy, you morticians really know how to party...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford's portable PHONE rests peacefully next to Smiley's crumpled body.  It RINGS.  Smiley achingly picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nyah, nyah, nyah-nyah, nyah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu finishes her squealing as a coolly smiling Ford takes the phone from her and hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tired and bruised, Ford and Zuzu sit side by side in a sparsely populated bus.  Zuzu is bobbing to a palm-size r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was one of the ten most provocative experiences of my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A disgruntled Ford takes the RADIO from her and turns it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get serious...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are all these people after me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh... wha?  You're supposed to answer those questions, not ask 'em.  I take it a woman named Colleen Sutton is not your big sister and that the late D.J. Johnny Crunch ain't your daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sure!  I'm an only child and my parents are Bill and Shirley Petals of South Bend, Indiana. They run a hardware store and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford reaches out and muzzles the sputtering girl with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hung out with Bobby Vomit. Who would want him dead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) I dunno.  He was to sound what Cezanne was to image or at least I thought so.  Ever since he died, I've been chased... Omigod!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Jesus, tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Spunk Lewis, the lead singer for Dead Ribbit!  Mr. Bus Driver, stop!

dialogues.speaker: ALLEY
dialogues.text: Spunk Lewis, generic rock star, emerges from a backstage door to sign autographs for a cluster of generic fans.

dialogues.speaker: BUS
dialogues.text: Ford shakes his head.  Zuzu's head is twisted around, trying to catch another glimpse of Spunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spunk, come back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How is it you can look at that HairHead and see God, when all I see is a lucky asshole from Reseda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I know rock-n-roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know rock-n-roll?  Darlin', I've been in the music industry for as long as you've lived.  I've seen things you can't even have nightmares about... but then I guess I'm just not equipped to know the industry the way you do...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come again?  B.FL.D., I have sex with rock stars; it's not like I'm doing something that I don't enjoy with them, like shuffleboard. Don't worry about me, I practice safe sex and next summer, I'm going to U.C.L.A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford flicks back ON the RADIO with a deprecating smile an flips it to Zuzu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu Petals, you're not bad.  In fact, I was discussing this whole rock-n-roll thing with my pal Art Mooney the other day.  You know him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Who's Art Mooney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the lamest clue I've ever had in my life.  Here's our stop...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford reaches up and pulls the cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not wearing glasses, Jazz makes her morning entrance into the office with an attack of melancholy.  She sees Zuzu sleeping at her desk behind a melting cup of yogurt.  For is amusingly curled up on the floor.  Jazz smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't I despise you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford rumbles into a semi-conscious position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you... Hey, where's your spex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Contacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu pops to life and resumes eating her yogurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He saved my life!  Isn't he the coolest man in the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Says a lot about the world... Zuzu Petals... Case closed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, what was the case?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Sutton hired you to find the girl.  Period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I guess her case is closed. Mine isn't.  I want to know why everybody wants Zuzu.  Why people are killing and dying for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's weird.  Bobby and Johnny were such good friends...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Friends?  You didn't tell me that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't ask.  Have you ever thought about mousse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PHONE RINGS.  Zuzu fiercely picks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: K-O-D-S is going to make me rich... Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz sweetly tears the phone away from her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's just a bundle of energy, a real treasure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, let's bury her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello... (hanging up) It's Colleen.  With answers.  She wants to meet.  Down.  Way down-town.  Late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too ultra-cool to be alive zombies, a mixture of play- tough trendoids and actual psychopaths, dressed in very black black, are packed together like burnt, sweating sardines.  A post-punk ACID CHILLER is throbbing from the SPEAKERS. An unamused Ford treads through the unsavory pack.  The crowd almost mystically parts to reveal Colleen, at a table by a window, in a violent leather ensemble, her hair slicked back. Ford sits himself down and a waiter pours him a Cappucino

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ask you to find a girl and instead you steal a C.D. from me. Ford.  You suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll buy you a new one.  I found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu Petals!  Did she have it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did she tell you anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of things.  Her favorite yogurt.  The ten drummers she would take to a desert island...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drink your cappucino, you're giving me a headache...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH RIFLE'S TELESCOPIC LENS, (THROUGH WINDOW)
dialogues.text: Targeted for destruction, Colleen rubs her temples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If feels like it's going to explode.

dialogues.speaker: CAFE
dialogues.text: A hole pops in the window and a VASE with a black rose in it EXPLODES on the table. Ford and Colleen are oblivious to the flying petals and the spurting water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damnit... you were right last night. Jonathan and I were into more than sex.  Along with Bobby Vomit, right after old Jack Grendel died, we took part in a scheme to rip off Grendel records... I didn't want you involved...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I am...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford brings a coffee cup toward its lip.  The CUP EXPLODE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What cheap shit... hey, waiter!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We invested in these factories. In Vancouver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold that thought.  Are we being shot at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford laughs.  Colleen laughs.  They laugh louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally got you to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly serious, Ford and Colleen bound away from the table into the seething masses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk Gunslinger and the Heavy Metal Gunslinger throw down their rifles (connected to huge silencers) in self- disgust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Colleen exhale happily, moving through the crowd

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was close...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did these Vancouver factories do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clubhounds swell between them, separating them. Colleen shouts above the zombies' heads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't told you the important part!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley suddenly abracadabras behind Colleen.  Her face contorts in agony and she falls.  Smiley bashes his way outward as a futile Ford twists and pushes to Colleen. A knife has been farmed in her spleen.  She croaks up her last words...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art Mo-o-o-ney!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, I needed that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley emerges out of the club, grinning into a walkie- talkie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You assholes owe me a Big Gulp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of THUNDER is heard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark daylight beats against the club along with falling RAIN.  The music has stopped and the place has been emptied of its ultra-cool swarm, replaced by the familiar cacophony of policemen and coroner officers.  A black bodybag is carried through the tables past a melancholy Ford, who sits, contemplating shot black rose petals until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a problem, call Ford Fairlane.  He won't solve your case, but who cares, you'll be dead in a couple days anyway. Let's face it.  After today, the California Raisins aren't gonna hire you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay.  I'm quitting the music detective business to become a cop killer.  Pay's the same, but it'll be much more fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I wish I could prove you killed everybody.  Unfortunately, I know who the real killer is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lt. Amos holds up a picture of Zuzu Petals blowing a kiss

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's some psycho killer groupie. I got an anonymous letter that says she killed Bobby Vomit, Johnny Crunch, and now, this society dame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once I got an anonymous letter saying that the world would be destroyed by a giant purple raindrop. I didn't even buy a fucking umbrella... You were in too many discos during the seventies.  The Village People rotted your brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the difference between a great investigator like me and a piece of Spam like you.  You look at this picture and all you see is beauty.  I see the beast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In counterpoint to Lt. Amos, Zuzu is seen babbling into a car phone in Jazz's Volkswagen, parked outside the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, on a car phone!  No, he's not a guitarist... he's better... He's a rock-n-roll detec --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oblivious to the rain, Jazz leans against her Bug with her arms folded meaningfully, watching Ford head toward her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Anus has discovered the cold-blooded killer behind everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford motions to inside the car.  Zuzu chatters away. When she sees she's being watched, she goofily waves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, an obvious choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get her out of here, before she starts a shoot-out.  Drop us at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz opens the passenger door for Ford.  As he gets in, compassionate looks are exchanged.  Jazz closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pretty tired Ford and a never tired Zuzu enter Chez Fairlane, the latter swinging her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you depressed?  You get in all the clubs, you never pay cover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.  We still got serious detective stuff to do, but we've been up all night so we should hit the sack for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teasing) What a perv...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford shakes his head and fumbles with the bedroom door as Zuzu somersaults onto the couch and retrieves a remote control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's watch some 'M.T.V.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People still watch that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who cares about people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu slides up into a sitting position on the back of the couch and raises the remote control...

dialogues.speaker: FORD'S BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Ford snaps on the light.  His koala bear is hanging from a noose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu!

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Zuzu presses the remote control.  Bah--oom!  The TELEVI- SION EXPLODES, blowing Zuzu off the couch against the back wall. Ford rushes into the smoky, raped, and abused living room and bolts down to the dazed and blackened Zuzu.  Ford shakes her into some sort of consciousness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu, wake up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hah fluck, great video, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay?  I just blew up.  I feel orgasmic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford glances up to see flames flickering at the curtains of his Jimi Hendrix guitar shrine.  With a mute howl of pain, he lets go of his grip on Zuzu, letting her head clunk to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Puh-leeze...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He speeds to the curtain and pulls.  The guitar is gone. Ford gasps for breath while Zuzu moves into a wobbly standing position behind him.  She walks OUT OF VIEW as Ford's anger finds sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My axe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford, do you got something cooking in the microwave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford stops gasping.  He races into his...

dialogues.speaker: KITCHENETTE
dialogues.text: Where Zuzu stands before a microwave oven, calmly combing ash out of her hair.  The timer reads 00:09... 00:08...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford grabs Zuzu by the hand and yanks her toward the door

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, my purse!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu breaks off from Ford to retrieve her purse on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, my purse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu zooms back and grabs Ford's hand, pulling him out th door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Zuzu burst from the house and dive onto the gras heads down.  A pause then a familiar BEEPING sound sig- nalling the end of a MICROWAVE cycle.  Zuzu lifts her hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it was just a pot pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAH-OOM!  A corner of the HOUSE neatly EXPLODES. Ford, lighting up a cigarette, and Zuzu achingly move into standing positions to watch the gently BELLOWING RUBBLE.  Neighbors come out of their places to take part in the fun. The Kid slowly approaches from behind the transfixed Ford and Zuzu.  His eye is black, his lip bleeding, and his shirt is torn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to stop them, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford spins around and The Kid collapses in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, you dummy.  Who did this to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These two guys in long cowboy coats and real nice suits.  I think Armani.  They were going through your stuff with screwdrivers and shit... I did what you would have done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Run to the nearest phone and call the police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that, I mean, the heck with that.  I kicked their ass! (coughing) Well, I tried.  There were two of them you know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, how could you be so stupid?  Come on, we're going to a hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid stands up and wiggles away from Ford.  He starts marching away toward the beach.  Ford follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I tried to help you...!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And hey, I appreciate it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning back) Where's my father?  Have you even looked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, uh, I got some pretty good leads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liar!  You don't care!  About anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kid runs off.  Ford gruffly exhales and turns to an arms-crossed Zuzu, who is not pleased about what she has seen. Ford and Zuzu straggle over to Ford's Fairlane with nice, new tires.  Ford pulls out his alarm beeper and raises it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, at least the guys at the garage brought my baby back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford presses the ALARM beeper button... BAH-OOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Battered and burned like Road Warrior extras, Ford and Zuzu drift down the side of the road.  They wearily exten their thumbs at a passing car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why the music industry?  Ford Fairlane, detective of the fishermen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weensy sports car containing two rich FRAT BOYS swerves to the side of the road.  As Ford and Zuzu rush to the car, the Frat Boys laugh and ride off. The license plate reads UNPOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah!  Mo-ther-fu --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford is about to lose it when suddenly Melodi, the killer cute nymph from the club daintily pulls up in a Cabriolet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, private eye guy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the poet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melodi buoyantly grabs a doorknob beneath some incom- prehensible Greek letters.  Ford and Zuzu try to brush themselves off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh wow, hiding out from cold blooded killers.  The sisters are going to die...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melodi swings open the door leading the VIEWER INTO:

dialogues.speaker: SORORITY HOUSE
dialogues.text: With a burst of LOUD MUSIC, the most ludicrous manifes- tation of the classic college-girls-behind-closed-doors fantasy unfolds in eye-popping fashion.  Girls in short- shorts are aerobicizing to the music, girls in Calvin Klein underwear with shredded tank tops are engaged in an intense game of Twister. A gorgeous girl precariously holds a towel against her body as she tries to iron her Garfield panties, two girls in negligees bite into their corn dogs.  A girl wearing only a strategic length T-shirt is tipping her bare toes, trying to change a bulb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, troops, here's that rock 'n' roll detective I told you about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a trance) Hebedeebuh.  Hebedeebuh.  Maybe I did die in the explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the feeling.  This must be hell.  Can you believe, a flucking sorority... I'm gonna vomit Day-Glo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-ah.  Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu turns to the stunned Ford and laughingly spanks him as the sorority sisters scamper over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't forget, Jazz, bonewad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz sits at her desk in the dimly, eerily lit office. The PHONE RINGS.  Jazz hits the speaker button, speaking somberly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Ford...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing at the office? You wouldn't believe what I've gone through tonight... I'm calling from the Mega Beta Pogo Sorority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford speaks on a wall phone while achingly watching a girl in a teddy slowly fill up a balloon in a faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmh!  My house was blown up, my car was blown up, and my koala bear isn't in too great a shape, either. (pausing) 'That's too bad.'  All you can say is 'That's too bad.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIEWER'S VIEWPOINT PULLS OUT ON Jazz in the eerily- lit office.  The Punk Gunslinger stands behind her, pointing a gun.  The HEAVY METAL GUNSLINGER sits across from her, doing the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Ford, that's all I can say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GIRLS have formed a giggling circle around Ford. Each sip a silly-colored wine cooler.  Zuzu is grudgingly having fun, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, then Springsteen says to Madonna, 'Hey, I only eat lime Jell-O...'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford gloats as the Girls laugh and applaud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Van Halen sleep in the nude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does Debbie Gibson sleep with Van Halen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Sting really an asshole?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Axl Rose was reincarnated as a black woman would he be Jodie Whatley or Aretha...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sisters, sisters, give Ford a break.  What do you say we induct him as an honorary member...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford wolfishly grins.  Zuzu rolls her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heavy Metal Gunslinger bobs up from a phone book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got an address for the sorority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning to Jazz) It's a tough business...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ever have a son, I hope his dog dies...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk Gunslinger pushes Jazz back against the Heavy Metal Gunslinger.  The Metal Gunslinger grabs her arms while the Punk grabs her legs.  They swing Jazz back and forth three times before heaving her SMASH! through the plate GLASS WINDOW of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sisters stand in semi-darkness around Ford, each holding a lit candle, and each wearing only a special robe.  Ford is also wearing a robe over boxer shorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quantas -- Jujubees -- Salcido -- Ford Fairlane -- Quantas -- Jujubees...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford looks over to Zuzu who stands by the window doing a "jerking off" motion.  Ford smiles, until he looks...

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH WINDOW
dialogues.text: The Two Gunslingers ride up in a Jeep without their lights on.

dialogues.speaker: SORORITY HOUSE
dialogues.text: Ford spins to the Sisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody, blow!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sisters blow out their candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still in his robe, Ford bounds across the lawns of variou sorority lawns until he is far from the malevolent Jeep. Ford stands at the top of an inclined street.  He looks to the Jeep at the foot of the hill before turning next to him.  Next to him is the sports car with the UNPOOR license plate. Ford reaches down to the emergency brake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Gunslingers intensely load their guns.  The Punk Gunslinger looks up, then back down, and suddenly back up again with a squeal.  The sports car is coming right at t Too late to run.  The sports car sails right into the JEEP, wounding it with a loud CRUNCH. FRAT BOYS pile out of the across-the-street-parties with howls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Du-udes, they executed my Midget!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Frat Boys thunder towards the Jeep.  The Punk Gunslinger exhales a "This ain't my night" breath before pulling out an UZI.  He SPRAYS a line of cars parked before the fraternity, SHATTERING WINDOWS, setting off CAR ALARMS, and sending scared Frat Boys running away squealing. POLICE SIRENS can be heard in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cut-our-losses time, dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The JEEP starts to SCREECH off, but then stops and backs up so the Heavy Metal Gunslinger can lob a GRENADE into the sports car. The Unpoor Frat Boy Driver watches in agony as his CAR EXPLODES.  Ford comes up from behind him, takes the Boy's hand and extends the thumb.  Ford grins.

dialogues.speaker: SORORITY
dialogues.text: A victorious Ford struts into the sorority to much applause.  Ford looks down to a box of water balloons and pulls out one with each hand.  High-energy MUSIC is playing on the STEREO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All work and no play makes Ford a dull boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water balloon fight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sisters, don't get your robes wet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sorority Sisters all start to yank off their robes wh suddenly a crumpled and bloodied Jazz enters the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do we have to have an office on the second floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz begins to collapse.  Ford drops his water balloons and catches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came to warn you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jazz, those bastards... call an ambulance!  Get that music off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I have a much more appropriate C.D.  Bobby sneaked it into my purse the day he died.  It was so romantic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu pulls out the red number one Black Vomit C.D. from her purse.  She goes to the compact disc player and slides it in. The painful COMPUTER SCREECHES:  SCRE-E-E-E!  BUZZ! SHSHSHSHSHSH! come croaking out the SPEAKERS.  The Sorority Sisters hold their ears, whimpering in pain, while Zuzu obliviously tries to dance to it.  Ford and Jazz smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't music!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is to us!  It's computerised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz takes the Black Vomit compact disc case (with a red number on it) from Jazz and holds it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe the last time we came across one of these, was at the ballet.  What were your words... (in Ford's gruff, facetious tone) 'A fucking C.D.  This case is closed.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) I've always said the one reason I'm the best detective in the industry is that I'm the only one... but hey, I never throw away a clue...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford triumphantly pulls the small toy duck from his pocket.  He frowns and throws it away, then pulls out Colleen's C.D.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sisters, the sorority computer...

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORNER OF SORORITY HOUSE
dialogues.text: The entire sorority and Zuzu are huddled around a seated Ford and slightly-cleaned-up Jazz, who is banging away at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aha, just what I suspected!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The computer screen is filled with incomprehensible, scrambled nonsense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is boring, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu, be quiet.  Put in Colleen's disc.  Number two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz slides Colleen's disc in the C.D. modem.  More scrambled nonsense of a different kind appears on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bor-ring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmmm, the first disc was putting out an incomprehensible stream of high bits.  This one is putting out low bits.  The data is in some fucked binary system.  The two discs need to interface simultaneously with a third decryptor disc.  Comprendo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Su-ure.  Two people hired me to find Zuzu in order to get hold of one of those discs and Colleen threw a tizz when we took hers.  Obviously, all this binary disc shit is pretty mighty. (standing up) But it's not necessary.  People are dead.  One was a friend.  The same people were involved in a scam to rip off Grendel Records. Bottom line's Julian Grendel is doing a little revenge number...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making quite a jump...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any proof?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just go up to Julian Grendel and say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford cuts them off with a deadpan blink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz, get to a hospital.  Zuzu and I are going to feel things out with Mr. Grendel.  If I don't call in an hour... hell, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bizarrely-over-the-top-high-tech.  Strange furniture -- gold records -- the spooky portrait of Julian and his father.  A nighttime cityscape sparkles through the windows.  Awnings meant for sunlight jut out and block moonlight. Bathed by high-tech lighting, wearing a tuxedo, Julian Grendel is pounding a feverishly-modulated CLASSICAL TUNE on a piano. When the VIEWER TAKES IN the sight of a confused Ford and Zuzu standing off to the side, the latter blowing gum bubbles, it is REVEALED that Julian's piano is literally soundless.  The piano has had all its chords ripped out.  The classical piece existed only in Julian's brain and on the soundtrack.  Julian's actual playing produces only a dull clicking sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, nice piano.  Probably get a lot of complaints from the neighbors -- heh...  It's another time, Julian, another place.  If I told you Bobby Vomit, Johnny Crunch, and Colleen Sutton were the ones you were complaining about, the ones who tried to rip you off, what would your reaction be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wry) Shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if I told you that you already knew all that shit, and that you had them killed, what would you do then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Golly, I'd probably faint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Smiley, smiling in another tie-dye shirt, non- chalantly walks into the room carrying a couple shirts in cleaners bags in his black-gloved hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh-oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bro, they still can't get that spot out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel downs Ford with a punch to the gut and tears the CDs from Ford's pocket.  Smiley laughs and whimsically shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford, you were right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian picks up a remote control and zaps a STEREO.  A dramatic CLASSICAL PIECE floats on.  He then coolly pops open the drawers of three CD modems beneath a large computer screen.  He plunks a disc in each...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually you're a bit off in the motivation department... I mean, revenge is so... Bronson. (furious, coming to the third modem) Wait, where's the third C.D.?  How could you come here without proof? It's a three piece set here!  A computer disc from Colleen, Bobby's computer disc, and Johnny's computer disc.  Together they make, oh fucking forget it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, I know the third one unscrambles the high bits and the low bits.  Shit, just start torturing me, man.  I didn't even know Johnny had a disc and I can't deal with any 'Don't play games with me, Mr. Fairlane' bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't play games... ugh.  Did you say you don't have the third... ugh. (a beat of contemplation) I'm not going to torture you, Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Gunslingers enter and along with everyone else in the room, look to Zuzu who obliviously pops a bubblegum bubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not her, Ford.  I'm afraid sometimes a pussy is just a pussy, but a 1962 Fender Stratocaster with an original Humbucking Pick-ups, maple neck, strung upside down for a left-handed genius -- Jimi Hendrix, is something else entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk Gunslinger lifts up Ford's beloved guitar out from under a couch in the office as Smiley bolts behind Ford and holds his arms behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  U-gh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's the sound your koala bear made when we hung it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel throws down the 2/3 and takes the guitar from the Punk.  He gently places the guitar on the table and takes a comfy seated position on the couch.  He flicks a switchblade and lowers it toward the guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't have to be like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, please, don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel fiendishly plucks a guitar string with the knife. Ford acts as if it was cutting off his tongue instead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think this guitar would look a lot neater with Ford's name on it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooooh, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk begins carving the letter F on the front of the guitar.  Ford gets dizzy.  Smiley has to slap him awake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rape!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Punk Gunslinger removes a power drill from his coat pocket and hands the cord to the Heavy Metal Gunslinger who scampers to an outlet to plug it in.  Julian takes th DRILL and turns it ON, GUNNING the power with wicked blis

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay!  Okay.  You got me.  Boy, you guys are tough.  I have the third disc.  Indeed.  I.  Do. Yes, sir. (smiling, a light bulb dimly lighting) Yeah you assholes, it's in a very safe place with instructions to have it sent directly to the police if I don't make a phone call by seven o'clock.  So if you'll excuse us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 7:30.  You really should get a watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, I didn't say seven P.M., now did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel laughs and lights up a cigarette.  He motions for Smiley to let go of Ford.  Ford proceeds to light up a cigarette also.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford.  Ford.  Ford.  It's too bad it had to end like this.  We could have been friends.  We're so much alike.  We both know 'Rock-N-Roll' is all bullshit.  That life is a disease and everyone's a victim. Hell, we even smoke the same brand of cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford is spooked.  He tosses his cigarette away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gave up smoking.  A last drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm running a little late.  You see, I'm having a party at THE Club to introduce the new lead singer for Black Vomit.  Everyone in the industry will be there, including our friend, Don Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Don?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Black Vomit starts its set, Don will have his head blown off. The papers next week will reveal that he was partners with Bobby, Johnny, and Collie in 'the Grendel Records scam.'  He killed them to pay off a debt to 'the mob' or something lame like that.  And then the mob iced him.  It's all more tasteful than it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you guys hung a koala bear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone turns in dismay to the batty girl.  The Heavy Metal Gunslinger is working the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is.  So.  Graphic.  I mean I'm still in shock here.  You know I had a dream about a priest hanging a koala bear during my first communion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading lips) Is she saying what I think she's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid so, you want her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know, that was just a dream.  Doesn't really count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Metal Gunslinger brings Julian and Ford each a glass of vodka.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising his glass) Julian, you're evil incarnate. And you know, while I'm a little angry that you're going to kill me and all, I gotta salute your toughness.  Life threw you lemons, and gall darnit, you made lemonade. Julian Grendel, guys like you don't grow on trees.  Here's to you... (smashing the glass into Julian's head) sucking my dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel spins off, howling in pain.  The Punk and Heavy Metal Gunslingers rush toward Ford but he dispatches both of them with swift punches.  Smiley though grabs him from behind and holds his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a free hit, bro.  Come on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel wipes off his face and steps toward Ford.  He then stops and with all his might, backhands Zuzu across the face, sending her tumbling to the floor.  He smiles and then gives her a kick in the ribs for good measure. Ford breaks from Smiley and rushes down to Zuzu.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kill them.  Not quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you ask me that question one more...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Zuzu speaks, Ford reaches in her mouth and pulls out her gum with one hand.  With the other hand, he removes one of her earrings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I say 'no,' run for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pausing at doorway) Oh, wait.  One sec.  Open the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Heavy Metal Gunslinger pries open the window.  Julian picks up Ford's guitar with two hands and heaves it over Ford and Zuzu's head and out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ciao.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel and the Punk Gunslinger make a brisk exit.  The Heavy Metal Gunslinger draws his gun while Smiley smiles and cracks his knuckles. For stands up and speaks whimsically...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hurt me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley punches Ford across the jaw -- snapping his head back.  He then grabs him by the collar and thrusts him across the wall -- smack -- over the desk -- into the wall.  Right next to a wall socket. Zuzu felinely kneels before the Heavy Metal Gunslinger, sneakily picking up the 2/3 C.D. from the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we're talking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford jams the earrings from his right hand into the chewed gum from his left hand and then shoves them into a wall socket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu punches the Gunslinger in the groin -- the EARRINGS SPARK -- and the lights go out.  The CLASSICAL MUSIC GRINDS TO A HALT and gives way to the sound of GRUNTS and PUNCHES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford rounds a corner, holding a hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford pulls the hand around the corner.  It belongs to the dazed Heavy Metal Gunslinger.  Ford with a brutal yank, pulls him into his knee, doubling him up.  Ford watches him drop to the floor as Zuzu rounds the corner holding her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice left you got there, jerk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, it was dark, now come on.

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: Ford and Zuzu race around another corridor.  Zuzu sees a door -- "Roof Access" -- she opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and the Heavy Metal Gunslinger chug around the corner.  Ford follows Zuzu...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Zuzu stumble out of a door, smack into a giant 10-foot needle jutting into the night sky.  Ford immediately wields back around and grabs for the roof access door, but it has closed.  He tries to open it, but it has locked.  A BULLET EXPLODES the lock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suck a dick, I left my purse...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Clark Gable said to Ava Gardner in Mogambo:  'Fuck the purse, we're gonna die-e-e.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reality-reality-reality -- Outrageous building, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ye-ah.

dialogues.speaker: CAPITAL RECORDS BUILDING
dialogues.text: A 14-story stack of records on Hollywood and Vine. Circular awnings ring each floor creating the illusion of a tower of discs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley and the Metal Gunslinger plow onto the roof.  Alon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Zuzu are climbing down and around the side of th building. The ledge is about a foot wide -- the sheet metal awning juts down and out at a forty-five degree angle just under and out from the ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you say I never take you anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two of them shimmy and sway along the edge until they reach a space in the awning.  Ford starts to lower himsel through the space to the next level, nine feet below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley looks over the edge -- straight down.  Between the cracks we can see Ford and Zuzu on their precarious journ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gunslinger gives him a "You've got to be kidding" look.  Smiley keeps smiling.  Nope.  The Metal Gunslinger takes off his gunslinger coat and his Armani jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu's feet dangle -- she hits the tiny ledge.  Ford steadies her. Ford tries to open a window, but it's locked.  He tries the next one -- they're all locked.  Ford kicks the window.  Bonk! -- the glass bounces, unaffected -- Whoa! -- Ford teeters from the hit -- falling -- Zuzu grabs him and pulls him back up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty smooth, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smooth.  I know this is dangerous and everything but it's kind of fun. Ever see "Batman," you know when Batman and Robin are climbing up the side of the building and somebody sticks their head outside the window and says... I forget what they said but it's pretty funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why have you come to my planet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BULLET ZINGS by!  Zuzu shrieks -- they look up. Between the spaces, the Metal Gunslinger points the business end of a gun between the awnings from the 14th floor ledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move along the side of the building -- making for th next space in the awning.

dialogues.speaker: DIFFERENT LEDGE
dialogues.text: Smiley hits the ledge and teeters.  He steadies and moves

dialogues.speaker: 11TH FLOOR
dialogues.text: drop down -- start working their way through the next gap

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHOT SPINS AROUND the Capitol Building.  Ford and Zuz are zigging and zagging and dropping down.  The Metal Gunslinger follows them from a few floors above -- going left and right.  Smiley is concentrating on going straigh down.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY METAL GUNSLINGER
dialogues.text: prepares to go down.  Sticking his gun in his mouth, he slaps down on the rim of the next ledge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His gun still in his mouth, the Gunslinger swings and fla his arms trying to get his equilibrium.  Falling backward he yelps out of the corner of his gun-clenching mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He-lp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu instinctively reaches out for him.  And grabs the GUN.  And the trigger. She innocently BLOWS the back of his head off.  The corpse bounces off the awning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the roof of the Wonder Bread tour bus, a TOUR GUIDE is blabbing through a bullhorn to a bunch of seated tourists

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is a symbol for the music industry, a business where anything can happen and usually...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The corpse of the Heavy Metal Gunslinger slams down befor him with a crash that turns into a gaping hole on the bus

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... does.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO NINTH FLOOR
dialogues.text: Zuzu flings the gun away from herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't ask why you would want to help someone trying to kill you, but hey, good job.  Shall we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford helps Zuzu drop her feet into the hap... and Smiley' hand juts up and grabs Zuzu's legs.  Smiley is in midair pulling down on Zuzu.  He must have jumped up to snatch t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it going?

dialogues.speaker: EIGHTH FLOOR
dialogues.text: Smiley and Zuzu fall down as one.  Slap! -- Smiley hits the ledge -- let's go of Zuzu -- and she falls outward. Clang! -- Zuzu slams into the slanted metal awning -- her feet slide out from underneath her like a bad ice skater -- she reaches for the ledge -- misses -- but slap!  She grabs onto the top edge of the awning. She lays there, at a forty-five degree angle, her feet sticking out into the atmosphere. And Smiley stands right above her grinning.  Smiley rests a steadying hand on the wall -- sticks his foot out towards the top of the awning -- towards Zuzu's fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Fo-ord!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUNK -- Ford drops from above and lands on the ledge behind Smiley.  Smiley's gloved hands lunge out at Ford and grab his throat.  Ford shoots his hands out and locks them on Smiley's neck. Zuzu hangs on for dear life as Ford and Smiley squeeze- push-twist -- both almost dependant on the other to keep balance.  Bored, Smiley decides to finish off Ford.  He swings Ford's head out a bit, then in, smashing Ford's skull against the building. The force of the smash knocks them both off balance. They twist -- tip -- let go of each other -- and both fall -- CLANG! -- CLANG! -- onto the METAL awning right next to Zuzu -- Smiley in the middle.  Each holding on with one hand to the CREAKING AWNING, they both start to wail punches on each other.  Then kicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluck this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zuzu gets into the act.  With her nails.  And Smiley's eyes.  She rips away blindly at his face. Smiley yells.  He loses his grip and starts to slide down -- until he grabs Ford's belt. Ford gleefully unloosens his belt and lets a desperate and descending Smiley yank it all the way out.  Ford reaches out to the belt at the last second.  He savors the sight of Smiley hanging on for dear life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to say that you're the biggest sissy in the whole wide world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm.  The.  Biggest.  Sissy.  In. The.  Wide.  World.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.  'B-y-e!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Ford can let go of the belt, he catches sight of Smiley's glove ripping open revealing a Snoopy-in-a fighter-pilot-suit ring, just like his son's, The Kid. The "Snoopy and the Red Baron" SONG PLAYS a couple of beats.  Ford looks to God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.  God.  You're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let go of the belt!  What are you doing?  You got mad at me for trying to save the other guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley starts to pull himself back up as Ford contemplate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't kill this kid's father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who do you think you are, Ford? The tooth fairy.  Kill!  Kill!  Kill!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is fucking unbelievable.  Zuzu, it's a long story, you see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiley suddenly lurches up to Ford's neck and starts strangling away.  And that's when the awning bends -- it wasn't built for this.  The angle changes from forty-five to twenty-five as all three people slam down and bounce. The Snoopy comes off in Ford's hand. They all lose their grip.  And free fall. In midair, Zuzu latches onto Ford's legs and Smiley latches onto Zuzu's legs.  Ford's elbow crunches through the edge of the next metal awning.  His encrusted elbow is the only thing that is keeping the dangling three-way chain of himself, Zuzu and Smiley from death.  All three howl and scream in amusing syncopation. Ford looks to his left and stops screaming.  Hanging from two good guitar strings, off a building thermometer, is the guitar.  Ford loudly cheers and breaks into a rendition of "Purple Haze."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Excuse me, while I kiss the sky.' (loudly hums a 'Haze' riff) Whoooo!  Oh, God, buddy, I'm sorry for calling you an asshole. You're number one, man!  Hey, Zuzu, look I found my guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford looks down to Zuzu who is rightfully wailing her head off.  Ford is slapped back into reality.  Ford looks over to his guitar, back down to Zuzu, then up to God. He whines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tearing me apart, here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford reaches over to his guitar and unhooks it from the thermometer with his free hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, Jimi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford fiercely flings down his guitar.  It blazes down int Smiley's face.  Smiley lets go of Zuzu with a final howl. Ford and the viewer watch the guitar swirl and spin in the air before crunching to the ground. Zuzu climbs up Ford's back and INTO the FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.  I know how much that thang meant to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They semi-romantically kiss.  Zuzu squeals in mock indignation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Mr. Tongue!  What a perv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling) You wish.  Come on, let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: ENTRANCE TO CAPITAL RECORDS BUILDING
dialogues.text: placidly sits before the viewer.  Suddenly, Ford and Zuzu, drop down from the TOP of the FRAME and land on their feet, their BACKS turned TO the CAMERA.  They stand shellshocked and motionless for a moment, until Ford turns around and tries to catch his breath.  Zuzu's body language says that she still thinks she's on a ledge. An AMIABLE TOURIST COUPLE approach the devastated duo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, could you give us directions to the Mann Chinese Theatre?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go back to Michigan, asswipe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're from Wisconsin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the fucking difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tourists flee, flabbergasted.  Ford goes to comfort Z

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glaring) There's that question...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz rushes up to the surly pair, wearing an eyepatch and a forearm cast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd it go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford and Zuzu give Jazz the look of death before contin- uing down the sidewalk, their heads drearily looking down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your timing swallows the massive one. Grendel just tried to kill us, he's about to frame and kiss Don, and we can't do shit.  Don't even ask about those discs. Goddamn that Art Mooney with a star by his name!  It's tied to Johnny's C.D., I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johnny's C.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe Art Mooney's the name of like a constellation...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And maybe the stars correlate with a map in the Thomas Guide... sounds pretty decaf, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz and Zuzu futiley look in the air as Ford moves for- ward with his head still down.  Ford suddenly stops and speaks with an increasingly beatific smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies, life's not that complicated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women race back to Ford as he falls to his knees and howls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Art, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VIEWER'S VIEWPOINT WILDLY SWINGS AROUND and DOWN to see a star, a Hollywood Walk of Fame star.  "Art Mooney" is printed just above a five inch record symbol. The ladies kneel down to the brain-racing Ford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh how sweet, your friend's got his own star.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ArtArtArtArtMooneyMooneyMooney Mooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford frantically massages the star.  He digs his nails into the little record symbol and POP!  It flips off the star, revealing a five inch hole.  A silvery rainbow sparkle comes from that inch.  Ford sticks his finger in -- And pulls out a compact disc (a red number three right on the disc).  A Black Vomit one.  The third CD. Exciting THEME MUSIC CRANKS on the SOUNDTRACK until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dazzling assortment of music industry-types bark and laugh with each other in a decidedly unfrivolous manner. This isn't a typical club scene.  Everyone here oozes importance. Julian Grendel works the crowd like Zeus, the CLASSICAL PIECE playing in his head and ON the SOUNDTRACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The more MODERN THEME MUSIC TAKES OVER as Ford, Jazz, and Zuzu barge into the room and head to Grendel's computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CLASSICAL MUSIC of Julian's brain RETURNS as he kisses each one of the Ovaries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MODERN MUSIC USURPS.  Ford, Jazz, and Zuzu each raise up a remote control and fire.  The three, filled, CD mode doors slides shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The short club owners, Jaime and Larry, converge on Julia

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the best party ever thrown here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's going to be a night to remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trio deals with a barrage of facts and figures on the computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What an interface!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems to be information about a factory in Vancouver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Colleen mentioned it.  What do they make?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C.D.s.  The music kind.  From the Grendel label.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without Grendel knowing about it. B-I-N-G-O and Bingo was his name-O. Counterfeit C.D.s.  Tape piracy has graduated to disc piracy, the sound quality's better, and so's the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the funny thing is, take a look at these Swiss bank account numbers. We got Bobby, Johnny, Colleen... and Julian Grendel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel keeps moving to genially thwap Don Cleveland on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish you could hear the buzz this party is making...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel it, man... Can I talk to you in private...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel ominously grabs Don's elbow with a chilling grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The gang takes it all in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel was in charge of the ripping off of the company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It started after Old Jack Grendel died, the others were just investors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After their initial investment in the factory, Grendel didn't need them.  Told them to fuck off. They tried to get these C.D.s together in order to have proof of Grendel's involvement, so they could keep him in line.  Now's the fun part...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe I lost an eye for a bunch of phony C.D.s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They race to the door.  Zuzu gets there first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God, the door's locked.  We're going to have to crawl down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gleefully opening the door) Psyche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel, Don, and the Punk Gunslinger stand tensely together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What can I say, Don, it's business. (to Punk Gunslinger) Dump the body in, let's say, Chinatown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julian oozes back into the club.  The Punk Gunslinger raises his silencer-gun to Don's chest... just as Jazz's Volkswagen storms into the alley.  The big bashes the Punk sending him flying over the car and crashing on the ground. Ford, Jazz, and Zuzu giddily bop out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Don, how's the high blood pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could somebody tell me what's going on?  Like slo-owly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You-see-it-all-starts-with-this- factory-in-Vancouver-and there's these-C.D.s...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll mail you a letter, come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ford, Zuzu, and Don go into the club.  A grinningly cock- sure Jazz walks around to the crumpled Punk Gunslinger, who achingly tries to crawl toward his gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see, you threw me through a plate glass window and I hit you with my Volkswagen.  I think we're in for a fair fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Gunslinger springs up and punches Jazz in the gut. She gasps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe not...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holding a radio mike, Grendel is in the throes of grandiosity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make jokes about the music industry.  They say it's cutthroat, they say it's cynical, well we know the truth!  There's a lot of love in this room tonight, but, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flash of reflected light hits Grendel's face causing him to wince.  He wiggles his head and continues...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've talked long enough.  Now, the moment you've been waiting for. I'd like you to meet the new singer for Black Vomit... Kyle Troy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kyle Troy, the untalented prettyboy from the studio comes out, wearing a heavy metal-style wig, to the bullshit applause of the crowd.  He is accompanied by a security guard. Grendel puts down the radio mike to applaud Kyle.  The flashing of reflected light hits Grendel a little more fiercely.  Annoyed, he looks offstage to its source.

dialogues.speaker: OFFSTAGE
dialogues.text: Ford Fairlane stands offstage waving the compact disc in the light and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: FORD
dialogues.text: exaggeratedly mouths...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read.  My.  Lips.  You're.  Going. Down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel's face drops and then switches back to a wide counterfeit grin, Grendel shuffles away from Kyle and the flashbulbs.  He steps over the radio mike he placed down on the stage.  A nubile hand reaches over the stage and grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz and the Punk Gunslinger crash into the Volkswagen, shoving, grappling, and kicking.  They crunch down onto the ground. The Gunslinger dives toward his gun.  But a foot steps on it.  Jazz and the Punk look up to see a quite dapper Sam the Ex-Sleaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to be just like you, abusing women to hide my emotional insecurities.  I realize now that a little insecurity is good for a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam the Sleazebag to the rescue!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dazed Punk Gunslinger leaps up and swings his fist at Sam, who catches it with one hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're ten seconds away from the most embarrassing moment of your life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and the Punk engage in a violent howling, wrestling match.  The Punk nails Sam with a kidney punch and then bolts toward his gun.  Jazz stands before him holding it nervously.  She lifts up her eyepatch to get better aim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please say you won't move!  I don't want to shoot you, actually I wouldn't mind, but please, say you won't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (charging toward her) Die, whore!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's a no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jazz EMPTIES the GUN into his chest, sending him to the ground.  Sam wearily rises up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Sam, vodka milkshakes are on me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel hungrily bolts into the backstage area, mock-worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd said something about proof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, Ford, I'll do any --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grendel humbly approaches Ford but then levels a karate- style kick into Ford's ribs.  He snatches the CD from Ford and splits it apart in the three pieces. He savagely begins eating the CD pieces, bloodily cutting his lips. Ford pulls five more CD's from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And may I suggest for dessert, the five copies I made...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe later, but first I want like to know why you'd steal from your own company...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
